ALIASES:　/novice, /nUSAGE:　/novice [message]→Sends a message to the [Novice Network]. The message will not be displayed if a PC has deselected [Novice Network] in the chat filter. Typing /novice or /n without a message switches the default chat mode to [Novice Network].>>Examples:　 /novice Hello　(Sends the message “Hello”　to the Novice Network.)　/novice　(Switches the default chat　mode to [Novice Network].)

ALIASES:　/say, /sUSAGE:　/say [message]→Sends a message to all PCs within a small radius. The message will not be displayed if a PC has deselected [Say] in the chat filter. Typing /say or /s without a message switches the default chat mode to [Say].
ALIASES:　/shout, /shUSAGE:　/shout [message]→Sends a message to all PCs in the same area. The message will not be displayed if a PC has deselected [Shout] in the chat filter.

ALIASES:　/tell, /tUSAGE:　/tell [PC name] [message]→Sends a message to a specific PC within the same World. This message cannot be seen by other PCs, and will not be displayed if [Tell] is deselected in the chat filter. Typing /tell or /t [PC name] without a message switches the default chat mode to [Tell]. Messages can also be sent to PCs on different Worlds provided they are on your friend list. This can be done by including "@World“ after the PC name.>>Example:　/tell [PC name] Hello　(Sends the message ”Hello“ to　 [PC name] on your World.)　/tell [PC name]@Bahamut Hello　(Sends the message ”Hello“ to　 [PC name] on the World Bahamut.)

ALIASES:　/party, /pUSAGE:　/party [message]→Sends a message to all members of your current party, regardless of their location. The message will not be displayed if a PC has deselected [Party] in the chat filter. Typing /party or /p without a message switches the default chat mode to [Party].

ALIASES:　/waymark, /wmarkUSAGE:　/wmark [marker] “target”→Place a waymark on the ground below a target. If no target is specified, a waymark will be placed beneath your cursor.>>Subcommands:　<Color(-154)>a </Color> Place or remove waymark A. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified.　<Color(-154)>b </Color> Place or remove waymark B. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified.　<Color(-154)>c </Color> Place or remove waymark C. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified.　<Color(-154)>d</Color> Place or remove waymark D. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified.　<Color(-154)>1</Color> Place or remove waymark 1. Overwrites existing wayrmark if target is specified.　<Color(-154)>2</Color> Place or remove wayrmark 2. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified. <Color(-154)> off</Color>/<Color(-154)>clear </Color> Remove all waymarks.Places an unused waymark in the order of A-D, 1, 2 when no subcommand is specified. More than six waymarks cannot be placed at one time. If a target name is specified, a marker name must also be specified.>>Examples:　/waymark A　(Places waymark A at the　selected location.)　/waymark A <t>　(Places waymark A at the　selected target's location.)

USAGE:　/wait [wait time]→A macro command for adjusting the pause between commands. A wait time amount of 1 equals one second. The maximum wait time allowed is 60. If the wait time amount is over 60, it will be counted as 60.

ALIASES:　/macroicon, /miconUSAGE:　/micon “icon name” [category]→Displays the specified icon as a hotbar icon. If used twice in a single user macro, only the first instance will be recognized.>>Categories:　<Color(-154)>action</Color>　　If the icon name is an　　action, action recast time　　and required MP/TP will　　be displayed with the icon.　<Color(-154)>pvpaction</Color>　　If the icon name is a　　pvp action, action recast　　time and required MP/TP will　　be displayed with the icon.　<Color(-154)>general</Color>　　If the icon name is a　　general action, action　　recast time will be　　displayed with the icon.　<Color(-154)>emote</Color>　　If the icon name is an　　emote, its icon will be　　displayed.　<Color(-154)>companion</Color>　　If the icon name is a　　companion action, its icon　　will be displayed.　<Color(-154)>pet</Color>　　If the icon name is a　　pet action, action recast　　time will be displayed with　　the icon.　<Color(-154)>minion</Color>　　If the icon name is a　　minion, its icon will be　　displayed.　<Color(-154)>mount</Color>　　If the icon name is a　　mount, its icon will be　　displayed.　<Color(-154)>enemysign</Color>　　If the icon name is an　　enemy sign, its icon will　　be displayed.　<Color(-154)>waymark</Color>　　If the icon name is a　　waymark, its icon will　　be displayed.　<Color(-154)>gearset</Color>　　If the icon name is a　　gear set number, its　　icon will be displayed.　<Color(-154)>classjob</Color>　　If the icon name is a　　class or job, its icon　　will be displayed.Category defaults to action when none is specified.

ALIASES:　　/itemsort, /isortUSAGE:　　/itemsort [subcommand]→Sorts your inventory based on the conditions given. This command does not effect the Sort function.>>Subcommands:　<Color(-154)>condition [Category]　[Condition] [Order]</Color>　　Sets the items to be sorted　　along with sorting order.　<Color(-154)>execute [Category]</Color>　　Sorts the specified items　　based on the conditions　　given.　<Color(-154)>clear [Category]</Color>　　Clears sort conditions for the　　specified item category.>>Categories:　<Color(-154)>inventory</Color>, <Color(-154)>retainer</Color>, <Color(-154)>armoury</Color>　<Color(-154)>mh</Color>, <Color(-154)>oh</Color>, <Color(-154)>head</Color>, <Color(-154)>body</Color>, <Color(-154)>hands</Color>　<Color(-154)>waist</Color>, <Color(-154)>legs</Color>, <Color(-154)>feet</Color>, <Color(-154)>neck</Color>, <Color(-154)>ears</Color>　<Color(-154)>wrists</Color>, <Color(-154)>rings</Color>, <Color(-154)>soul</Color>>>Conditions:　<Color(-154)>id</Color>, <Color(-154)>spiritbond</Color>, <Color(-154)>category</Color>, <Color(-154)>lv</Color>, <Color(-154)>ilv</Color>　<Color(-154)>stack</Color>, <Color(-154)>hq</Color>, <Color(-154)>materia</Color>, <Color(-154)>pdamage</Color>　<Color(-154)>mdamage</Color>, <Color(-154)>delay</Color>, <Color(-154)>autoattack</Color>　<Color(-154)>blockrate</Color>, <Color(-154)>blockstrength</Color>　<Color(-154)>defense</Color>, <Color(-154)>mdefense</Color>　<Color(-154)>str</Color>, <Color(-154)>dex</Color>, <Color(-154)>vit</Color>, <Color(-154)>int</Color>, <Color(-154)>mnd</Color>　<Color(-154)>craftsmanship</Color>, <Color(-154)>control</Color>　<Color(-154)>gathering</Color>, <Color(-154)>perception</Color>, <Color(-154)>tab</Color>>>Order:　<Color(-154)>asc</Color>, <Color(-154)>des</Color> Defaults to ascending if order is not specified. Cannot be used if one of the conditions is “tab”.>>Example:　/isort condition mh lv asc　(Sets main arms to be sorted　by ascending equipping level.)　/itemsort condition mh ilv des　(Sets main arms to be sorted　by descending item level.)　/itemsort execute mh　(Sorts main arms based on　the above conditions.)

USAGE:　/hotbar [subcommand]→Edit and configure hotbar settings. Only available in PvE areas.>>Subcommands　<Color(-154)>action “action name” [#1] [#2]</Color>　　Set the specified action to slot [#2] in hotbar page [#1]. If “current” is entered for [#1], then the action will be set in the page displayed in hotbar 1. If [#2] is omitted, the action will be set to the lowest-numbered slot available.
